messages: 0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (14:14): bugmail: [Bug 8000] ARIA roles added to the a element should be conforming in HTML5 <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Oct/0800.html>
4d389837f8ff4967ac73a3d840c55ece (14:25): v.nu-build: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 * r79 /trunk/build.py: Alert the user if there is an svn-based htmlparser directory.
4d389837f8ff4967ac73a3d840c55ece (14:25): v.nu-build: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 * r80 /trunk/build.py: Avoid --rebase, since it is a extension feature.
4d389837f8ff4967ac73a3d840c55ece (14:25): v.nu-build: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 * r81 /trunk/build.py: Without --rebase, need --update instead.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:38): issue: Should spec require whitespace normalization of attribute values, particularly in title attribute?
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (14:38): noticed an ISSUE. Trying to create it.

22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (14:38): Created ISSUE-87 - Should spec require whitespace normalization of attribute values, particularly in title attribute? ; please complete additional details at http://www.w3.org/html/wg/tracker/issues/87/edit .
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:39): issue-87: escalated from http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=8003
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (14:39): attempting to add a note to ISSUE-87.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (14:39): ISSUE-87 Should spec require whitespace normalization of attribute values, particularly in title attribute? notes added
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (14:39): 8003: <email/>, P2, NEW, line breaks in attributes (especially title)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:40): somewhat wonders when we'll have resolved all the issues

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (14:42): planet: Are Web Workers themselves allowed to have Web Worker threads? <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1512119/are-web-workers-themselves-allowed-to-have-web-worker-threads>
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:44): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Extrapolate from the graph :)
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (14:44): bugmail: [Bug 7978] Form foster parenting introduces extra space to layout <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Oct/0801.html>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:45): is unhappy about ISSUE-87 being an ISSUE
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:46): mjs, is there a draft agenda available somewhere for next week?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:47): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: isn't that how The Process works these days?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:48): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: the reporter of the bug could also accept the editor's resolution.

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:51): The Process means the reporter typically gets a short response from the editor and no other feedback, and the next step is to escalate into an Issue, and there's no encouragement to e.g. discuss the issue on the mailing list first so the reporter can see if they have a wrong/minority opinion or if the editor was being wrong
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:51): s/first/before escalating/
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:52): The only thing that really sucks about the current (IE/WebKit) behavior is that HTML-unaware line wrapping in a text editor can introduce wraps in tooltips
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:53): but we aren't going to break <input type=hidden>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:53): and authors want the ability to put line breaks in tooltips
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:53): FWIW I really dislike the current behaviour for exactly that reason
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:53): so inventing something that differs from the way IE/WebKit have worked forever would suck
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:53): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Different attributes could be parsed differently
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:53): But not to the extent that I would make an Issue about it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:53): just don't worry about it
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:53): (Not suggesting that's a good idea...)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:53): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Don't worry about what?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:53): all you can do is waste time on this issue
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:54): it's not like anything will actually change
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:59): the current decision policy document doesn't leave much choice if a commentor chooses to drop in the TrackerRequest keyword, or escalate it themselves
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:00): the way to prevent it from being escalated before enough discussion has taken place is to now move it to Resolved before some discussion has taken place

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:00): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I wasn't planning to spend any time on it. The choice seems to be between a stupid and harmful behaviour and a broken behaviour
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:01): So a good outcome isn't really possible
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:01): s/now move it/not move it/
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:02): if MS said they'd be OK with changing this in IE9 across all modes, I might be more interested in changing this
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:02): I rather like the current behavior personally
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:02): anyway...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:02): well, I guess we'll see how the Process deals with IE/WebKit legacy
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:03): notes that Gecko tried to be righteous here for years but authors still seemed to like the "broken" IE/WebKit behavior
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:13): it's a bit weird to read speculation of what I would or would not have in mind if I volunteered to edit RDFa in HTML

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (15:15): bugmail: [Bug 7978] Form foster parenting introduces extra space to layout <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Oct/0803.html> ** [Bug 8003] line breaks in attributes (especially title) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Oct/0802.html>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:15): anyway, I figured it's best not to contribute to the volume of public-html by taking part in the speculation of what I would or wouldn't have in mind
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:15): It wouldn't be so speculative if you said it, though
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:18): His motives for saying them would be, though
